REBEL BLOCKADE RUNNER A woman's hand puts a card into an opening in Artoo's dome. Artoo makes beeping sounds. INT. REBEL BLOCKADE RUNNER Threepio stands in a hallway, somewhat bewildered. Artoo is nowhere in sight. The pitiful screams of the doomed Rebel soldiers can be heard in the distance.
a: Artoo! Artoo-Detoo, where are you? A familiar clanking sound attacks Threepio's attention and he spots little Artoo at the end of the hallway in a smoke- filled alcove. A beautiful young girl (about sixteen years old) stands in front of Artoo. Surreal and out of place, dreamlike and half hidden in the smoke, she finishes adjusting something on Artoo's computer face, then watches as the little robot joins his companion.

q: THREEPIO: Artoo! Artoo-Detoo, where are you? A familiar clanking sound attacks Threepio's attention and he spots little Artoo at the end of the hallway in a smoke- filled alcove. A beautiful young girl (about sixteen years old) stands in front of Artoo. Surreal and out of place, dreamlike and half hidden in the smoke, she finishes adjusting something on Artoo's computer face, then watches as the little robot joins his companion.
a: At last! Where have you been? Stormtroopers can be heard battling in the distance.

q: THREEPIO: At last! Where have you been? Stormtroopers can be heard battling in the distance.
a: They're heading in this direction. What are we going to do? We'll be sent to the spice mine of Kessel or smashed into who knows what! Artoo scoots past his bronze friend and races down the subhallway. Threepio chases after him.

q: THREEPIO: They're heading in this direction. What are we going to do? We'll be sent to the spice mine of Kessel or smashed into who knows what! Artoo scoots past his bronze friend and races down the subhallway. Threepio chases after him.
a: Wait a minute, where are you going? Artoo responds with electronic beeps. INT. REBEL BLOCKADE RUNNER - CORRIDOR The evil Darth Vader stands amid the broken and twisted bodies of his foes. He grabs a wounded Rebel Officer by the neck as an Imperial Officer rushes up to the Dark Lord.

q: THREEPIO: Wait a minute, where are you going? Artoo responds with electronic beeps. INT. REBEL BLOCKADE RUNNER - CORRIDOR The evil Darth Vader stands amid the broken and twisted bodies of his foes. He grabs a wounded Rebel Officer by the neck as an Imperial Officer rushes up to the Dark Lord.
a: The Death Star plans are not in the main computer. Vader squeezes the neck of the Rebel Officer, who struggles in vain.

q: IMPERIAL OFFICER: The Death Star plans are not in the main computer. Vader squeezes the neck of the Rebel Officer, who struggles in vain.
a: Where are those transmissions you intercepted? Vader lifts the Rebel off his feet by his throat.

q: VADER: Where are those transmissions you intercepted? Vader lifts the Rebel off his feet by his throat.
a: What have you done with those plans?

q: VADER: What have you done with those plans?
a: We intercepted no transmissions. Aaah... This is a consular ship. Were on a diplomatic mission.

q: REBEL OFFICER: We intercepted no transmissions. Aaah... This is a consular ship. Were on a diplomatic mission.
a: If this is a consular ship... were is the Ambassador? The Rebel refuses to speak but eventually cries out as the Dark Lord begins to squeeze the officer's throat, creating a gruesome snapping and choking, until the soldier goes limp. Vader tosses the dead soldier against the wall and turns to his troops.

q: VADER: If this is a consular ship... were is the Ambassador? The Rebel refuses to speak but eventually cries out as the Dark Lord begins to squeeze the officer's throat, creating a gruesome snapping and choking, until the soldier goes limp. Vader tosses the dead soldier against the wall and turns to his troops.
a: Commander, tear this ship apart until you've found those plans and bring me the Ambassador. I want her alive! The stormtroopers scurry into the subhallways. INT. REBEL BLOCKADE RUNNER - SUBHALLWAY The lovely young girl huddles in a small alcove as the stormtroopers search through the ship. She is Princess Leia Organa, a member of the Alderaan Senate. The fear in her eyes slowly gives way to anger as the muted crushing sounds of the approaching stormtroopers grow louder. One of the troopers spots her.

q: VADER: Commander, tear this ship apart until you've found those plans and bring me the Ambassador. I want her alive! The stormtroopers scurry into the subhallways. INT. REBEL BLOCKADE RUNNER - SUBHALLWAY The lovely young girl huddles in a small alcove as the stormtroopers search through the ship. She is Princess Leia Organa, a member of the Alderaan Senate. The fear in her eyes slowly gives way to anger as the muted crushing sounds of the approaching stormtroopers grow louder. One of the troopers spots her.
a: There she is! Set for stun! Leia steps from her hiding place and blasts a trooper with her laser pistol. She starts to run but is felled by a paralyzing ray. The troopers inspect her inert body.

q: TROOPER: There she is! Set for stun! Leia steps from her hiding place and blasts a trooper with her laser pistol. She starts to run but is felled by a paralyzing ray. The troopers inspect her inert body.
a: She'll be all right. Inform Lord Vader we have a prisoner. INT. REBEL BLOCKADE RUNNER - SUBHALLWAY Artoo stops before the small hatch of an emergency lifepod. He snaps the seal on the main latch and a red warning light begins to flash. The stubby astro-robot works his way into the cramped four-man pod.

q: TROOPER: She'll be all right. Inform Lord Vader we have a prisoner. INT. REBEL BLOCKADE RUNNER - SUBHALLWAY Artoo stops before the small hatch of an emergency lifepod. He snaps the seal on the main latch and a red warning light begins to flash. The stubby astro-robot works his way into the cramped four-man pod.
a: Hey, you're not permitted in there. It's restricted. You'll be deactivated for sure.. Artoo beeps something to him.

q: THREEPIO: Hey, you're not permitted in there. It's restricted. You'll be deactivated for sure.. Artoo beeps something to him.
a: Don't call me a mindless philosopher, you overweight glob of grease! Now come out before somebody sees you. Artoo whistles something at his reluctant friend regarding the mission he is about to perform.

q: THREEPIO: Don't call me a mindless philosopher, you overweight glob of grease! Now come out before somebody sees you. Artoo whistles something at his reluctant friend regarding the mission he is about to perform.
a: Secret mission? What plans? What are you talking about? I'm not getting in there! Artoo isn't happy with Threepio's stubbornness, and he beeps and twangs angrily. A new explosion, this time very close, sends dust and debris through the narrow subhallway. Flames lick at Threepio and, after a flurry of electronic swearing from Artoo, the lanky robot jumps into the lifepod.

q: THREEPIO: Secret mission? What plans? What are you talking about? I'm not getting in there! Artoo isn't happy with Threepio's stubbornness, and he beeps and twangs angrily. A new explosion, this time very close, sends dust and debris through the narrow subhallway. Flames lick at Threepio and, after a flurry of electronic swearing from Artoo, the lanky robot jumps into the lifepod.
a: I'm going to regret this. INT. IMPERIAL STARDESTROYER On the main viewscreen, the lifepod carrying the two terrified robots speeds away from the stricken Rebel spacecraft.

q: THREEPIO: I'm going to regret this. INT. IMPERIAL STARDESTROYER On the main viewscreen, the lifepod carrying the two terrified robots speeds away from the stricken Rebel spacecraft.
a: There goes another one.

q: CHIEF PILOT: There goes another one.
a: Hold your fire. There are no life forms. It must have been short- circuited. INT. LIFEPOD Artoo and Threepio look out at the receding Imperial starship. Stars circle as the pod rotates through the galaxy.

q: CAPTAIN: Hold your fire. There are no life forms. It must have been short- circuited. INT. LIFEPOD Artoo and Threepio look out at the receding Imperial starship. Stars circle as the pod rotates through the galaxy.
a: That's funny, the damage doesn't look as bad from out here. Artoo beeps an assuring response.

q: THREEPIO: That's funny, the damage doesn't look as bad from out here. Artoo beeps an assuring response.
a: Are you sure this things safe? EXT. TATOOINE - ANCHORHEAD SETTLEMENT - POWER STATION - DAY Heat waves radiate from the dozen or so bleached white buildings. Luke pilots his Landspeeder through the dusty empty street of the tiny settlement. An old woman runs to get out of the way of the speeding vehicle, shaking her fist at Luke as he flies past.

q: THREEPIO: Are you sure this things safe? EXT. TATOOINE - ANCHORHEAD SETTLEMENT - POWER STATION - DAY Heat waves radiate from the dozen or so bleached white buildings. Luke pilots his Landspeeder through the dusty empty street of the tiny settlement. An old woman runs to get out of the way of the speeding vehicle, shaking her fist at Luke as he flies past.
a: I've told you kids to slow down! INT. POWER STATION - DAY Luke bursts into the power station, waking The Fixer, a rugged mechanic and Camie, a sexy, disheveled girl who has been asleep in his lap. They grumbled as he races through the office, yelling wildly.

q: WOMAN: I've told you kids to slow down! INT. POWER STATION - DAY Luke bursts into the power station, waking The Fixer, a rugged mechanic and Camie, a sexy, disheveled girl who has been asleep in his lap. They grumbled as he races through the office, yelling wildly.
a: Did I hear a young noise blast through here?

q: FIXER: Did I hear a young noise blast through here?
a: It was just wormie on another rampage. Luke bounces into a small room behind the office where Deak and Windy, two tough boys about the same age as Luke, are playing a computer pool-like game with Biggs, a burly, handsome boy a few years older than the rest. His flashy city attire is a sharp contrast to the loose-fitting tunics of the farm boys. A robot repairs some equipment in the background.

q: CAMIE: It was just wormie on another rampage. Luke bounces into a small room behind the office where Deak and Windy, two tough boys about the same age as Luke, are playing a computer pool-like game with Biggs, a burly, handsome boy a few years older than the rest. His flashy city attire is a sharp contrast to the loose-fitting tunics of the farm boys. A robot repairs some equipment in the background.
a: Shape it up you guys!... Biggs? Luke's surprise at the appearance of Biggs gives way to great joy and emotion. They give each other a great bear hug.

q: LUKE: Shape it up you guys!... Biggs? Luke's surprise at the appearance of Biggs gives way to great joy and emotion. They give each other a great bear hug.
a: I didn't know you were back! When did you get in?

q: LUKE: I didn't know you were back! When did you get in? he laughs
a: Just now. I wanted to surprise you, hot shot. I thought you'd be here... certainly didn't expect you to be out working.

q: BIGGS: Just now. I wanted to surprise you, hot shot. I thought you'd be here... certainly didn't expect you to be out working.
a: The Academy didn't change you much...but you're back so soon? Hey, what happened, didn't you get your commission? Biggs has an air of cool that seems slightly phony.

q: LUKE: The Academy didn't change you much...but you're back so soon? Hey, what happened, didn't you get your commission? Biggs has an air of cool that seems slightly phony. he salutes
a: Of course I got it. Signed aboard The Rand Ecliptic last week. First mate Biggs Darklighter at your service... ...I just came to say good-bye to all you unfortunate landlocked simpletons. Everyone laughs. The dazzling spectacle of his dashing friend is almost too much for Luke, but suddenly he snaps out of it.

q: BIGGS: Of course I got it. Signed aboard The Rand Ecliptic last week. First mate Biggs Darklighter at your service... ...I just came to say good-bye to all you unfortunate landlocked simpletons. Everyone laughs. The dazzling spectacle of his dashing friend is almost too much for Luke, but suddenly he snaps out of it.
a: I almost forgot. There's a battle going on! Right here in our system. Come and look!

q: LUKE: I almost forgot. There's a battle going on! Right here in our system. Come and look!
a: Not again! Forget it. EXT. TATOOINE - ANCHORHEAD - SETTLEMENT - POWER STATION -

q: DEAK: Not again! Forget it. EXT. TATOOINE - ANCHORHEAD - SETTLEMENT - POWER STATION -
a: The group stumbles out into the stifling desert sun. Camie and The Fixer complain and are forced to shade their eyes. Luke has his binoculars out scanning the heavens.

q: DAY: The group stumbles out into the stifling desert sun. Camie and The Fixer complain and are forced to shade their eyes. Luke has his binoculars out scanning the heavens.
a: There they are! Biggs takes the binoculars from Luke as the others strain to see something with the naked eye. Through the binoculars Biggs sees two small silver specks.

q: LUKE: There they are! Biggs takes the binoculars from Luke as the others strain to see something with the naked eye. Through the binoculars Biggs sees two small silver specks.
a: That's no battle, hot shot... they're just sitting there! Probably a freighter-tanker refueling.

q: BIGGS: That's no battle, hot shot... they're just sitting there! Probably a freighter-tanker refueling.
a: But there was a lot of firing earlier... Camie grabs the binoculars away banging them against the building in the process. Luke grabs them.

q: LUKE: But there was a lot of firing earlier... Camie grabs the binoculars away banging them against the building in the process. Luke grabs them.
a: Hey, easy with those...

q: LUKE: Hey, easy with those...
a: Don't worry about it, Wormie. The Fixer gives Luke a hard look and the young farm boy shrugs his shoulders in resignation.

q: CAMIE: Don't worry about it, Wormie. The Fixer gives Luke a hard look and the young farm boy shrugs his shoulders in resignation.
a: I keep telling you, the Rebellion is a long way from here. I doubt if the Empire would even fight to keep this system. Believe me Luke, this planet is a big hunk of nothing... Luke agrees, although it's obvious he isn't sure why. The group stumbles back into the power station, grumbling about Luke's ineptitude. INT. REBEL BLOCKADE RUNNER - HALLWAY Princess Leia is led down a low-ceilinged hallway by a squad of armored stormtroopers. Her hands are bound and she is brutally shoved when she is unable to keep up with the briskly marching troops. They stop in a smoky hallway as Darth Vader emerges from the shadows. The sinister Dark Lord stares hard at the frail young senator, but she doesn't move.

q: FIXER: I keep telling you, the Rebellion is a long way from here. I doubt if the Empire would even fight to keep this system. Believe me Luke, this planet is a big hunk of nothing... Luke agrees, although it's obvious he isn't sure why. The group stumbles back into the power station, grumbling about Luke's ineptitude. INT. REBEL BLOCKADE RUNNER - HALLWAY Princess Leia is led down a low-ceilinged hallway by a squad of armored stormtroopers. Her hands are bound and she is brutally shoved when she is unable to keep up with the briskly marching troops. They stop in a smoky hallway as Darth Vader emerges from the shadows. The sinister Dark Lord stares hard at the frail young senator, but she doesn't move.
a: Lord Vader, I should have known. Only you could be so bold. The Imperial Senate will not sit for this, when they hear you've attacked a diplomatic...

q: LEIA: Lord Vader, I should have known. Only you could be so bold. The Imperial Senate will not sit for this, when they hear you've attacked a diplomatic...
a: Don't play games with me, Your Highness. You weren't on any mercy mission this time. You passed directly through a restricted system. Several transmissions were beamed to this ship by Rebel spies. I want to know what happened to the plans they sent you.

q: VADER: Don't play games with me, Your Highness. You weren't on any mercy mission this time. You passed directly through a restricted system. Several transmissions were beamed to this ship by Rebel spies. I want to know what happened to the plans they sent you.
a: I don't know what you're talking about. I'm a member of the Imperial Senate on a diplomatic mission to Alderaan...

q: LEIA: I don't know what you're talking about. I'm a member of the Imperial Senate on a diplomatic mission to Alderaan...
a: You're a part of the Rebel Alliance... and a traitor. Take her away! Leia is marched away down the hallway and into the smoldering hole blasted in the side of the ship. An Imperial Commander turns to Vader.

q: VADER: You're a part of the Rebel Alliance... and a traitor. Take her away! Leia is marched away down the hallway and into the smoldering hole blasted in the side of the ship. An Imperial Commander turns to Vader.
a: Holding her is dangerous. If word of this gets out, it could generate sympathy for the Rebellion in the senate.

q: COMMANDER: Holding her is dangerous. If word of this gets out, it could generate sympathy for the Rebellion in the senate.
a: I have traced the Rebel spies to her. Now she is my only link to find their secret base!

q: VADER: I have traced the Rebel spies to her. Now she is my only link to find their secret base!
a: She'll die before she tells you anything.

q: COMMANDER: She'll die before she tells you anything.
a: Leave that to me. Send a distress signal and then inform the senate that all aboard were killed! Another Imperial Officer approaches Vader and the Commander. They stop and snap to attention.

q: VADER: Leave that to me. Send a distress signal and then inform the senate that all aboard were killed! Another Imperial Officer approaches Vader and the Commander. They stop and snap to attention.
a: Lord Vader, the battle station plans are not aboard this ship! And no transmissions were made. An escape pod was jettisoned during the fighting, but no life forms were aboard. Vader turns to the Commander.

q: SECOND OFFICER: Lord Vader, the battle station plans are not aboard this ship! And no transmissions were made. An escape pod was jettisoned during the fighting, but no life forms were aboard. Vader turns to the Commander.
a: She must have hidden the plans in the escape pod. Send a detachment down to retrieve them. See to it personally, Commander. There'll be no one to stop us this time.

q: VADER: She must have hidden the plans in the escape pod. Send a detachment down to retrieve them. See to it personally, Commander. There'll be no one to stop us this time.
a: Yes, sir. EXT. SPACE The Imperial Stardestroyer comes over the surface of the planet Tatooine. EXT. TATOOINE - DESERT Jundland, or "No Man's Land", where the rugged desert mesas meet the foreboding dune sea. The two helpless astro-droids kick up clouds of sand as they leave the lifepod and clumsily work their way across the desert wasteland. The lifepod in the distance rests half buried in the sand.

q: COMMANDER: Yes, sir. EXT. SPACE The Imperial Stardestroyer comes over the surface of the planet Tatooine. EXT. TATOOINE - DESERT Jundland, or "No Man's Land", where the rugged desert mesas meet the foreboding dune sea. The two helpless astro-droids kick up clouds of sand as they leave the lifepod and clumsily work their way across the desert wasteland. The lifepod in the distance rests half buried in the sand.
a: How did I get into this mess? I really don't know how. We seem to be made to suffer. It's our lot in life. Artoo answers with beeping sounds.

q: THREEPIO: How did I get into this mess? I really don't know how. We seem to be made to suffer. It's our lot in life. Artoo answers with beeping sounds.
a: I've got to rest before I fall apart. My joints are almost frozen. Artoo continues to respond with beeping sounds.

q: THREEPIO: I've got to rest before I fall apart. My joints are almost frozen. Artoo continues to respond with beeping sounds.
a: What a desolate place this is. Suddenly Artoo whistles, makes a sharp right turn and starts off in the direction of the rocky desert mesas. Threepio stops and yells at him.

q: THREEPIO: What a desolate place this is. Suddenly Artoo whistles, makes a sharp right turn and starts off in the direction of the rocky desert mesas. Threepio stops and yells at him.
a: Where are you going? A stream of electronic noises pours forth from the small robot.

q: THREEPIO: Where are you going? A stream of electronic noises pours forth from the small robot.
a: Well, I'm not going that way. It's much too rocky. This way is much easier. Artoo counters with a long whistle.

q: THREEPIO: Well, I'm not going that way. It's much too rocky. This way is much easier. Artoo counters with a long whistle.
a: What makes you think there are settlements over there? Artoo continues to make beeping sounds.

q: THREEPIO: What makes you think there are settlements over there? Artoo continues to make beeping sounds.
a: Don't get technical with me. Artoo continues to make beeping sounds.

q: THREEPIO: Don't get technical with me. Artoo continues to make beeping sounds.
a: What mission? What are you talking about? I've had just about enough of you! Go that way! You'll be malfunctioning within a day, you nearsighted scrap pile! Threepio gives the little robot a kick and starts off in the direction of the vast dune sea.

q: THREEPIO: What mission? What are you talking about? I've had just about enough of you! Go that way! You'll be malfunctioning within a day, you nearsighted scrap pile! Threepio gives the little robot a kick and starts off in the direction of the vast dune sea.
a: And don't let me catch you following me begging for help, because you won't get it. Artoo's reply is a rather rude sound. He turns and trudges off in the direction of the towering mesas.

q: THREEPIO: And don't let me catch you following me begging for help, because you won't get it. Artoo's reply is a rather rude sound. He turns and trudges off in the direction of the towering mesas.
a: No more adventures. I'm not going that way. Artoo beeps to himself as he makes his way toward the distant mountains. EXT. TATOOINE - DUNE SEA Threepio, hot and tired, struggles up over the ridge of a dune; only to find more dunes, which seem to go on for endless miles.  He looks back in the direction of the now distant rock mesas.

q: THREEPIO: No more adventures. I'm not going that way. Artoo beeps to himself as he makes his way toward the distant mountains. EXT. TATOOINE - DUNE SEA Threepio, hot and tired, struggles up over the ridge of a dune; only to find more dunes, which seem to go on for endless miles.  He looks back in the direction of the now distant rock mesas.
a: That malfunctioning little twerp. This is all his fault! He tricked me into going this way, but he'll do no better. In a huff of anger and frustration, Threepio knocks the sand from his joints. His plight seems hopeless, when a glint of reflected light in the distance reveals an object moving towards him.

q: THREEPIO: That malfunctioning little twerp. This is all his fault! He tricked me into going this way, but he'll do no better. In a huff of anger and frustration, Threepio knocks the sand from his joints. His plight seems hopeless, when a glint of reflected light in the distance reveals an object moving towards him.
a: Wait, what's that? A transport! I'm saved! The bronze android waves frantically and yells at the approaching transport.

q: THREEPIO: Wait, what's that? A transport! I'm saved! The bronze android waves frantically and yells at the approaching transport.
a: Over here! Help! Please, help! EXT. TATOOINE - ANCHORHEAD SETTLEMENT - POWER STATION - DAY Luke and Biggs are walking and drinking a malt brew. Fixer and the others can be heard working inside.

q: THREEPIO: Over here! Help! Please, help! EXT. TATOOINE - ANCHORHEAD SETTLEMENT - POWER STATION - DAY Luke and Biggs are walking and drinking a malt brew. Fixer and the others can be heard working inside. Very animated
a: ...so I cut off my power, shut down the afterburners and came in low on Deak's trail. I was so close I thought I was going to fry my instruments. As it was I busted up the Skyhopper pretty bad. Uncle Owen was pretty upset. He grounded me for the rest of the season. You should have been there... it was fantastic.

q: LUKE: ...so I cut off my power, shut down the afterburners and came in low on Deak's trail. I was so close I thought I was going to fry my instruments. As it was I busted up the Skyhopper pretty bad. Uncle Owen was pretty upset. He grounded me for the rest of the season. You should have been there... it was fantastic.
a: You ought to take it easy Luke. You may be the hottest bushpilot this side of Mos Eisley, but those little Skyhoppers are dangerous. Keep it up, and one day, whammo, you're going to be nothing more than a dark spot on the down side of a canyon wall.

q: BIGGS: You ought to take it easy Luke. You may be the hottest bushpilot this side of Mos Eisley, but those little Skyhoppers are dangerous. Keep it up, and one day, whammo, you're going to be nothing more than a dark spot on the down side of a canyon wall.
a: Look who's talking. Now that you've been around those giant starships you're beginning to sound like my uncle. You've gotten soft in the city...

q: LUKE: Look who's talking. Now that you've been around those giant starships you're beginning to sound like my uncle. You've gotten soft in the city...
a: I've missed you kid.

q: BIGGS: I've missed you kid.
a: Well, things haven't been the same since you left, Biggs. It's been so... quiet. Biggs looks around then leans close to Luke.

q: LUKE: Well, things haven't been the same since you left, Biggs. It's been so... quiet. Biggs looks around then leans close to Luke.
a: Luke, I didn't come back just to say good-bye... I shouldn't tell you this, but you're the only one I can trust... and if I don't come back, I want somebody to know. Luke's eyes are wide with Biggs' seriousness and loyalty.

q: BIGGS: Luke, I didn't come back just to say good-bye... I shouldn't tell you this, but you're the only one I can trust... and if I don't come back, I want somebody to know. Luke's eyes are wide with Biggs' seriousness and loyalty.
a: What are you talking about?

q: LUKE: What are you talking about? he whispers
a: I made some friends at the Academy. ...when our frigate goes to one of the central systems, we're going to jump ship and join the Alliance... Luke, amazed and stunned, is almost speechless.

q: BIGGS: I made some friends at the Academy. ...when our frigate goes to one of the central systems, we're going to jump ship and join the Alliance... Luke, amazed and stunned, is almost speechless.
a: Join the Rebellion?! Are you kidding! How?

q: LUKE: Join the Rebellion?! Are you kidding! How?
a: Quiet down will ya! You got a mouth bigger than a meteor crater!

q: BIGGS: Quiet down will ya! You got a mouth bigger than a meteor crater! he whispers
a: I'm sorry. I'm quiet. Listen how quiet I am. You can barely hear me... Biggs shakes his head angrily and then continues.

q: LUKE: I'm sorry. I'm quiet. Listen how quiet I am. You can barely hear me... Biggs shakes his head angrily and then continues.
a: My friend has a friend on Bestine who might help us make contact.

q: BIGGS: My friend has a friend on Bestine who might help us make contact.
a: You're crazy! You could wander around forever trying to find them.

q: LUKE: You're crazy! You could wander around forever trying to find them.
a: I know it's a long shot, but if I don't find them I'll do what I can on my own... It's what we always talked about. Luke, I'm not going to wait for the Empire to draft me into service. The Rebellion is spreading and I want to be on the right side -- the side I believe in.

q: BIGGS: I know it's a long shot, but if I don't find them I'll do what I can on my own... It's what we always talked about. Luke, I'm not going to wait for the Empire to draft me into service. The Rebellion is spreading and I want to be on the right side -- the side I believe in.
a: And I'm stuck here...

q: LUKE: And I'm stuck here...
a: I thought you were going to the Academy next term. You'll get your chance to get off this rock.

q: BIGGS: I thought you were going to the Academy next term. You'll get your chance to get off this rock.
a: Not likely! I had to cancel my application. There has been a lot of unrest among the Sandpeople since you left... they've even raided the outskirts of Anchorhead.

q: LUKE: Not likely! I had to cancel my application. There has been a lot of unrest among the Sandpeople since you left... they've even raided the outskirts of Anchorhead.
a: Your uncle could hold off a whole colony of Sandpeople with one blaster.

q: BIGGS: Your uncle could hold off a whole colony of Sandpeople with one blaster.
a: I know, but he's got enough vaporators going to make the place pay off. He needs me for just one more season. I can't leave him now.

q: LUKE: I know, but he's got enough vaporators going to make the place pay off. He needs me for just one more season. I can't leave him now.
a: I feel for you, Luke, you're going to have to learn what seems to be important or what really is important. What good is all your uncle's work if it's taken over by the Empire?... You know they're starting to nationalize commerce in the central systems... it won't be long before your uncle is merely a tenant, slaving for the greater glory of the Empire.

q: BIGGS: I feel for you, Luke, you're going to have to learn what seems to be important or what really is important. What good is all your uncle's work if it's taken over by the Empire?... You know they're starting to nationalize commerce in the central systems... it won't be long before your uncle is merely a tenant, slaving for the greater glory of the Empire.
a: It couldn't happen here. You said it yourself. The Empire won't bother with this rock.

q: LUKE: It couldn't happen here. You said it yourself. The Empire won't bother with this rock.
a: Things always change.

q: BIGGS: Things always change.

a: So long, Luke. Biggs turns away from his old friend and heads towards the power station. EXT. TATOOINE - ROCK CANYON - SUNSET The gargantuan rock formations are shrouded in a strange foreboding mist and the onimous sounds of unearthly creatures fill the air. Artoo moves cautiously through the creepy rock canyon, inadvertently making a loud clicking noise as he goes. He hears a distant, hard, metallic sound and stops for a moment. Convinced he is alone, he continues on his way. In the distance, a pebble tumbles down the steep canyon wall and a small dark figure darts into the shadows. A little further up the canyon a slight flicker of light reveals a pair of eyes in the dark recesses only a few feet from the narrow path. The unsuspecting robot waddles along the rugged trail until suddenly, out of nowhere, a powerful magnetic ray shoots out of the rocks and engulfs him in an eerie glow. He manages one short electronic squeak before he topples over onto his back. His bright computer lights flicker off, then on, then off again. Out of the rocks scurry three Jawas, no taller than Artoo. They holster strange and complex weapons as they cautiously approach the robot. They wear grubby cloaks and their faces are shrouded so only their glowing eyes can be seen. They hiss and make odd guttural sounds as they heave the heavy robot onto their shoulders and carry him off down the trail. EXT. TATOOINE - ROCK CANYON - SANDCRAWLER - SUNSET The eight Jawas carry Artoo out of the canyon to a huge tank- like vehicle the size of a four-story house. They weld a small disk on the side of Artoo and then put him under a large tube on the side of the vehicle and the little robot is sucked into the giant machine. The filthy little Jawas scurry like rats up small ladders and enter the main cabin of the behemoth transport. INT. SANDCRAWLER - HOLD AREA It is dim inside the hold area of the Sandcrawler. Artoo switches on a small floodlight on his forehead and stumbles around the scrap heap. The narrow beam swings across rusty metal rocket parts and an array of grotesquely twisted and maimed astro-robots. He lets out a pathetic electronic whimper and stumbles off toward what appears to be a door at the end of the chamber. INT. SANDCRAWLER - PRISON AREA Artoo enters a wide room with a four-foot ceiling. In the middle of the scrap heap sit a dozen or so robots of various shapes and sizes. Some are engaged in electronic conversation, while others simply mill about. A voice of recognition calls out from the gloom.

TATOOINE - DESERT - LARS HOMESTEAD - AFTERNOON The Jawas mutter gibberish as they busily line up their battered captives, including Artoo and Threepio, in front of the enormous Sandcrawler, which is parked beside a small homestead consisting of three large holes in the ground surrounded by several tall moisture vaporators and one small adobe block house. The Jawas scurry around fussing over the robots, straightening them up or brushing some dust from a dented metallic elbow. The shrouded little creatures smell horribly, attracting small insects to the dark areas when their mouths and nostrils should be. Out of the shadows of a dingy side-building limps Owen Lars, a large burly man in his mid-fifties. His reddish eyes are sunken in a dust-covered face. As the farmer carefully inspects each robot, he is closely followed by his slump- shouldered nephew, Luke Skywalker. One of the vile little Jawas walks ahead of the farmer spouting an animated sales pitch in a queer, unintelligible language. A voice calls out from one of the huge holes that form the homestead. Luke goes over to the edge and sees his Aunt Beru standing in the main courtyard.

Luke watches the distant Tusken Raider through his electrobinoculars. Suddenly something huge moves in front of his field of view. Before Luke or Threepio can react, a large, gruesome Tusken Raider looms over them. Threepio is startled and backs away, right off the side if the cliff. He can be heard for several moments as he clangs, bangs and rattles down the side of the mountain. The towering creature brings down his curved, double-pointed gaderffii -- the dreaded axe blade that has struck terror in the heart of the local settlers. But Luke manages to block the blow with his laser rifle, which is smashed to pieces. The terrified farm boy scrambles backward until he is forced to the edge of a deep crevice. The sinister Raider stands over him with his weapon raised and lets out a horrible shrieking laugh. EXT. TATOOINE - ROCK CANYON - FLOOR - DAY Artoo forces himself into the shadows of a small alcove in the rocks as the vicious Sandpeople walk past carrying the inert Luke Skywalker, who is dropped in a heap before the speeder.  The Sandpeople ransack the speeder, throwing parts and supplies in all directions. Suddenly they stop. Then everything is quiet for a few moments. A great howling moan is heard echoing throughout the canyon which sends the Sandpeople fleeing in terror. Artoo moves even tighter into the shadows as the slight swishing sound that frightened off the Sandpeople grows even closer, until a shabby old desert-rat-of-a-man appears and leans over Luke. His ancient leathery face, cracked and weathered by exotic climates is set off by dark, penetrating eyes and a scraggly white beard. Ben Kenobi squints his eyes as he scrutinizes the unconscious farm boy. Artoo makes a slight sound and Ben turns and looks right at him.

q: BEN: Your fathers lightsaber. This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster. Luke pushes a button on the handle. A long beam shoots out about four feet and flickers there. The light plays across the ceiling.
a: An elegant weapon for a more civilized time. For over a thousand generations the Jedi Knights were the guardians of peace and justice in the Old Republic. Before the dark times, before the Empire. Luke hasn't really been listening.

q: BEN: An elegant weapon for a more civilized time. For over a thousand generations the Jedi Knights were the guardians of peace and justice in the Old Republic. Before the dark times, before the Empire. Luke hasn't really been listening.
a: How did my father die?

q: LUKE: How did my father die?
a: A young Jedi named Darth Vader, who was a pupil of mine until he turned to evil, helped the Empire hunt down and destroy the Jedi Knights. He betrayed and murdered your father. Now the Jedi are all but extinct. Vader was seduced by the dark side of the Force.

q: BEN: A young Jedi named Darth Vader, who was a pupil of mine until he turned to evil, helped the Empire hunt down and destroy the Jedi Knights. He betrayed and murdered your father. Now the Jedi are all but extinct. Vader was seduced by the dark side of the Force.
a: The Force?

q: LUKE: The Force?
a: Well, the Force is what gives a Jedi his power. It's an energy field created by all living things. It surrounds us and penetrates us. It binds the galaxy together. Artoo makes beeping sounds.

a: Now, let's see if we can't figure out what you are, my little friend. And where you come from.

a: I saw part of the message he was... Luke is cut short as the recorded image of the beautiful young Rebel princess is projected from Artoo's face.

q: LUKE: I saw part of the message he was... Luke is cut short as the recorded image of the beautiful young Rebel princess is projected from Artoo's face.
a: I seem to have found it. Luke stops his work as the lovely girl's image flickers before his eyes.

q: BEN: I seem to have found it. Luke stops his work as the lovely girl's image flickers before his eyes.
a: General Kenobi, years ago you served my father in the Clone Wars. Now he begs you to help him in his struggle against the Empire. I regret that I am unable to present my father's request to you in person, but my ship has fallen under attack and I'm afraid my mission to bring you to Alderaan has failed. I have placed information vital to the survival of the Rebellion into the memory systems of this R2 unit. My father will know how to retrieve it. You must see this droid safely delivered to him on Alderaan. This is our most desperate hour. Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi, you're my only hope. There is a little static and the transmission is cut short. Old Ben leans back and scratches his head. He silently puffs on a tarnished chrome water pipe. Luke has stars in his eyes.

a: You must learn the ways of the Force if you're to come with me to Alderaan.

q: BEN: You must learn the ways of the Force if you're to come with me to Alderaan. laughing
a: Alderaan? I'm not going to Alderaan. I've got to go home. It's late, I'm in for it as it is.

a: I need your help, Luke. She needs your help. I'm getting too old for this sort of thing.

a: You must do what you feel is right, of course. EXT. SPACE. An Imperial Stardestroyer heads toward the evil planet-like battle station: the Death Star! INT. Commander Tagge, a young, slimy-looking general, is speaking.

a: Until this battle station is fully operational we are vulnerable. The Rebel Alliance is too well equipped. They're more dangerous than you realize. The bitter Admiral Motti twists nervously in his chair.

q: TAGGE: Until this battle station is fully operational we are vulnerable. The Rebel Alliance is too well equipped. They're more dangerous than you realize. The bitter Admiral Motti twists nervously in his chair.

a: The Rebellion will continue to gain a support in the Imperial Senate as long as.... The Dark Lord stands behind him.

The Dark Lord stands behind him.
a: The Imperial Senate will no longer be of any concern to us. I've just received word that the Emperor has dissolved the council permanently. The last remnants of the Old Republic have been swept away.

q: TARKIN: The Imperial Senate will no longer be of any concern to us. I've just received word that the Emperor has dissolved the council permanently. The last remnants of the Old Republic have been swept away.
a: That's impossible! How will the Emperor maintain control without the bureaucracy?

q: TAGGE: That's impossible! How will the Emperor maintain control without the bureaucracy?
a: The regional governors now have direct control over territories. Fear will keep the local systems in line. Fear of this battle station.

q: TARKIN: The regional governors now have direct control over territories. Fear will keep the local systems in line. Fear of this battle station.
a: And what of the Rebellion? If the Rebels have obtained a complete technical readout of this station, it is possible, however unlikely, that they might find a weakness and exploit it.

q: TAGGE: And what of the Rebellion? If the Rebels have obtained a complete technical readout of this station, it is possible, however unlikely, that they might find a weakness and exploit it.
a: The plans you refer to will soon be back in our hands.

q: VADER: The plans you refer to will soon be back in our hands.
a: Any attack made by the Rebels against this station would be a useless gesture, no matter what technical data they've obtained. This station is now the ultimate power in the universe. I suggest we use it!

q: MOTTI: Any attack made by the Rebels against this station would be a useless gesture, no matter what technical data they've obtained. This station is now the ultimate power in the universe. I suggest we use it!

a: Don't try to frighten us with your sorcerer's ways, Lord Vader. Your sad devotion to that ancient religion has not helped you conjure up the stolen data tapes, or given you clairvoyance enough to find the Rebel's hidden fort... Suddenly Motti chokes and starts to turn blue under Vader's spell.

a: As you wish.

a: This bickering is pointless. Lord Vader will provide us with the location of the Rebel fortress by the time this station is operational. We will then crush the Rebellion with one swift stroke. a: These are the same Jawas that sold us Artoo and Threepio.

q: LUKE: These are the same Jawas that sold us Artoo and Threepio.

TATOOINE - WASTELAND The Landspeeder with Luke, Artoo, Threepio, and Ben in it zooms across the desert. The speeder stops on a bluff overlooking the spaceport at Mos Eisley. Luke adjusts his goggles and walks to the edge of the craggy bluff where Ben is standing.

a: The Force can have a strong influence on the weak-minded. You will find it a powerful ally.

a: I'm ready for anything.

A huge, rough-looking Bartender stops Luke and the robots.

a: We don't serve their kind here! Luke still recovering from the shock of seeing so many outlandish creatures, doesn't quite catch the bartender's drift.

q: BARTENDER: We don't serve their kind here! Luke still recovering from the shock of seeing so many outlandish creatures, doesn't quite catch the bartender's drift.

a: Listen, why don't you wait out by the speeder. We don't want any trouble.

q: LUKE: Listen, why don't you wait out by the speeder. We don't want any trouble.
a: I heartily agree with you sir. Threepio and his stubby partner go outside and most of the creatures at the bar go back to their drinks. Ben is standing next to Chewbacca, an eight-foot-tall savage- looking creature resembling a huge grey bushbaby monkey with fierce baboon-like fangs. His large blue eyes dominate a fur- covered face and soften his otherwise awesome appearance. Over his matted, furry body he wears two chrome bandoliers, and little else. He is a two-hundred-year-old Wookiee and a sight to behold. Ben speaks to the Wookiee, pointing to Luke several times during his conversation and the huge creature suddenly lets out a horrifying laugh. Luke is more than a little bit disconcerted and pretends not to hear the conversation between Ben and the giant Wookiee. Luke is terrified but tries not to show it. He quietly sips his drink, looking over the crowd for a more sympathetic ear or whatever. A large, multiple-eyed Creature gives Luke a rough shove.

q: BEN: Plug in. He should be able to interpret the entire Imperial computer network. Artoo punches his claw arm into the computer socket and the vast Imperial brain network comes to life, feeding information to the little robot. After a few moments, he beeps something.
a: He says he's found the main computer to power the tractor beam that's holding the ship here. He'll try to make the precise location appear on the monitor. The computer monitor flashes readouts.

q: THREEPIO: He says he's found the main computer to power the tractor beam that's holding the ship here. He'll try to make the precise location appear on the monitor. The computer monitor flashes readouts.
a: The tractor beam is coupled to the main reactor in seven locations. A power loss at one of the terminals will allow the ship to leave. Ben studies the data on the monitor readout.

q: THREEPIO: The tractor beam is coupled to the main reactor in seven locations. A power loss at one of the terminals will allow the ship to leave. Ben studies the data on the monitor readout.
a: I don't think you boys can help. I must go alone.

q: BEN: I don't think you boys can help. I must go alone.
a: Whatever you say. I've done more that I bargained for on this trip already.

q: HAN: Whatever you say. I've done more that I bargained for on this trip already.
a: I want to go with you.

q: LUKE: I want to go with you.
a: Be patient, Luke. Stay and watch over the droids.

q: BEN: Be patient, Luke. Stay and watch over the droids.
a: But he can...

q: LUKE: But he can...
a: They must be delivered safely or other star systems will suffer the same fate as Alderaan. Your destiny lies along a different path than mine. The Force will be with you... always! Ben adjusts the lightsaber on his belt and silently steps out of the command office, then disappears down a long grey hallway. Chewbacca barks a comment and Han shakes his head in agreement.

q: BEN: They must be delivered safely or other star systems will suffer the same fate as Alderaan. Your destiny lies along a different path than mine. The Force will be with you... always! Ben adjusts the lightsaber on his belt and silently steps out of the command office, then disappears down a long grey hallway. Chewbacca barks a comment and Han shakes his head in agreement.
a: Boy you said it, Chewie. Han looks at Luke.

q: HAN: Boy you said it, Chewie. Han looks at Luke.
a: Where did you dig up that old fossil?

q: HAN: Where did you dig up that old fossil?
a: Ben is a great man.

q: LUKE: Ben is a great man.
a: Yeah, great at getting us into trouble.

q: HAN: Yeah, great at getting us into trouble.
a: I didn't hear you give any ideas...

q: LUKE: I didn't hear you give any ideas...
a: Well, anything would be better than just hanging around waiting for him to pick us up...

q: HAN: Well, anything would be better than just hanging around waiting for him to pick us up...
a: Who do you think... Suddenly Artoo begins to whistle and beep a blue streak. Luke goes over to him.

q: LUKE: Who do you think... Suddenly Artoo begins to whistle and beep a blue streak. Luke goes over to him.
a: What is it?

q: LUKE: What is it?
a: I'm afraid I'm not quite sure, sir. He says "I found her", and keeps repeating, "She's here."

q: THREEPIO: I'm afraid I'm not quite sure, sir. He says "I found her", and keeps repeating, "She's here."
a: Well, who... who has he found? Artoo whistles a frantic reply.

q: LUKE: Well, who... who has he found? Artoo whistles a frantic reply.
a: Princess Leia.

q: THREEPIO: Princess Leia.
a: The princess? She's here?

q: LUKE: The princess? She's here?
a: Princess? What's going on?

q: HAN: Princess? What's going on?
a: Level five. Detention block A A-twenty- three. I'm afraid she's scheduled to be terminated.

q: THREEPIO: Level five. Detention block A A-twenty- three. I'm afraid she's scheduled to be terminated.
a: Oh, no! We've got to do something.

q: LUKE: Oh, no! We've got to do something.
a: What are you talking about?

q: HAN: What are you talking about?
a: The droid belongs to her. She's the one in the message... We've got to help her.

q: LUKE: The droid belongs to her. She's the one in the message... We've got to help her.
a: Now, look, don't get any funny ideas. The old man wants us to wait right here.

q: HAN: Now, look, don't get any funny ideas. The old man wants us to wait right here.
a: But he didn't know she was here. Look, will you just find a way back into the detention block?

q: LUKE: But he didn't know she was here. Look, will you just find a way back into the detention block?
a: I'm not going anywhere.

q: HAN: I'm not going anywhere.
a: They're going to execute her. Look, a few minutes ago you said you didn't want to just wait here to be captured. Now all you want to do is stay.

q: LUKE: They're going to execute her. Look, a few minutes ago you said you didn't want to just wait here to be captured. Now all you want to do is stay.
a: Marching into the detention area is not what I had in mind.

q: HAN: Marching into the detention area is not what I had in mind.
a: But they're going to kill her!

q: LUKE: But they're going to kill her!
a: Better her than me...

q: HAN: Better her than me...
a: She's rich. Chewbacca growls.

q: LUKE: She's rich. Chewbacca growls.
a: Rich?

q: HAN: Rich?
a: Yes. Rich, powerful! Listen, if you were to rescue her, the reward would be...

q: LUKE: Yes. Rich, powerful! Listen, if you were to rescue her, the reward would be...
a: What?

q: HAN: What?
a: Well more wealth that you can imagine.

q: LUKE: Well more wealth that you can imagine.
a: I don't know, I can imagine quite a bit!

q: HAN: I don't know, I can imagine quite a bit!
a: You'll get it!

q: LUKE: You'll get it!
a: I better!

q: HAN: I better!
a: You will...

q: LUKE: You will...
a: All right, kid. But you'd better be right about this. Han looks at Chewie, who grunts a short grunt.

q: HAN: All right, kid. But you'd better be right about this. Han looks at Chewie, who grunts a short grunt.
a: All right.

q: LUKE: All right.
a: What's your plan?

q: HAN: What's your plan?
a: Uh... Threepio, hand me those binders there will you? Luke moves toward Chewbacca with electronic cuffs.

q: LUKE: Uh... Threepio, hand me those binders there will you? Luke moves toward Chewbacca with electronic cuffs.
a: Okay. Now, I'm going to put these on you. Chewie lets out a hideous growl.

q: LUKE: Okay. Now, I'm going to put these on you. Chewie lets out a hideous growl.
a: Okay. Han, you put these on. Luke sheepishly hands the binders to Han.

q: LUKE: Okay. Han, you put these on. Luke sheepishly hands the binders to Han.
a: Don't worry, Chewie. I think I know what he has in mind. The Wookiee has a worried and frightened look on his face as Han binds him with the electronic cuffs.

q: HAN: Don't worry, Chewie. I think I know what he has in mind. The Wookiee has a worried and frightened look on his face as Han binds him with the electronic cuffs.
a: Master Luke, sir! Pardon me for asking... but, ah... what should Artoo and I do if we're discovered here?

q: THREEPIO: Master Luke, sir! Pardon me for asking... but, ah... what should Artoo and I do if we're discovered here?
a: Lock the door!

q: LUKE: Lock the door!
a: And hope they don't have blasters.

q: HAN: And hope they don't have blasters.
a: That isn't very reassuring. Luke and Han put on their armored stormtrooper helmets and start off into the giant Imperial Death Star. INT. DEATH STAR - DETENTION AREA - ELEVATOR TUBE Han and Luke try to look inconspicuous in their armored suits as they wait for a vacuum elevator to arrive. Troops, bureaucrats, and robots bustle about, ignoring the trio completely. Only a few give the giant Wookiee a curious glance. Finally a small elevator arrives and the trio enters.

q: THREEPIO: That isn't very reassuring. Luke and Han put on their armored stormtrooper helmets and start off into the giant Imperial Death Star. INT. DEATH STAR - DETENTION AREA - ELEVATOR TUBE Han and Luke try to look inconspicuous in their armored suits as they wait for a vacuum elevator to arrive. Troops, bureaucrats, and robots bustle about, ignoring the trio completely. Only a few give the giant Wookiee a curious glance. Finally a small elevator arrives and the trio enters.
a: I can't see a thing in this helmet. A bureaucrat races to get aboard also, but is signaled away by Han. The door to the pod-like vehicle slides closed and the elevator car takes off through a vacuum tube. INT. DEATH STAR - MAIN HALLWAY Several Imperial officers walk through the wide main passageway. They pass several stormtroopers and a robot similar to Threepio but with an insect face. At the far end of the hallway, a passing flash of Ben Kenobi appears, then disappears down a small hallway. His appearance is so fleeting that it is hard to tell if he is real or just an illusion. No one in the hallway seems to notice him. INT. DEATH STAR - INTERIOR ELEVATOR - DETENTION SECURITY

q: LUKE: I can't see a thing in this helmet. A bureaucrat races to get aboard also, but is signaled away by Han. The door to the pod-like vehicle slides closed and the elevator car takes off through a vacuum tube. INT. DEATH STAR - MAIN HALLWAY Several Imperial officers walk through the wide main passageway. They pass several stormtroopers and a robot similar to Threepio but with an insect face. At the far end of the hallway, a passing flash of Ben Kenobi appears, then disappears down a small hallway. His appearance is so fleeting that it is hard to tell if he is real or just an illusion. No one in the hallway seems to notice him. INT. DEATH STAR - INTERIOR ELEVATOR - DETENTION SECURITY
a: Luke and Han step forward to exit the elevator, but the door slides open behind them. The giant Wookiee and his two guards enter the old grey security station. Guards and laser gates are everywhere. Han whispers to Luke under his breath.

q: AREA: Luke and Han step forward to exit the elevator, but the door slides open behind them. The giant Wookiee and his two guards enter the old grey security station. Guards and laser gates are everywhere. Han whispers to Luke under his breath.
a: This is not going to work.

q: HAN: This is not going to work.
a: Why didn't you say so before?

q: LUKE: Why didn't you say so before?
a: I did say so before! INT. DETENTION AREA Elevator doors open. A tall, grim looking Officer approaches the trio.

q: HAN: I did say so before! INT. DETENTION AREA Elevator doors open. A tall, grim looking Officer approaches the trio.
a: Where are you taking this... thing? Chewie growls a bit at the remark but Han nudges him to shut up.

q: OFFICER: Where are you taking this... thing? Chewie growls a bit at the remark but Han nudges him to shut up.
a: Prisoner transfer from Block one-one- three-eight.

q: LUKE: Prisoner transfer from Block one-one- three-eight.
a: I wasn't notified. I'll have to clear it. The officer goes back to his console and begins to punch in the information. There are only three other troopers in the area. Luke and Han survey the situation, checking all of the alarms, laser gates, and camera eyes. Han unfastens one of Chewbacca's electronic cuffs and shrugs to Luke. Suddenly Chewbacca throws up his hands and lets out with one of his ear-piercing howls. He grabs Han's laser rifle.

q: OFFICER: I wasn't notified. I'll have to clear it. The officer goes back to his console and begins to punch in the information. There are only three other troopers in the area. Luke and Han survey the situation, checking all of the alarms, laser gates, and camera eyes. Han unfastens one of Chewbacca's electronic cuffs and shrugs to Luke. Suddenly Chewbacca throws up his hands and lets out with one of his ear-piercing howls. He grabs Han's laser rifle.
a: Look out! He's loose!

q: HAN: Look out! He's loose!
a: He's going to pull us all apart.

q: LUKE: He's going to pull us all apart.
a: Go get him! The startled guards are momentarily dumbfounded. Luke and Han have already pulled out their laser pistols and are blasting away at the terrifying Wookiee. Their barrage of laserfire misses Chewbacca, but hits the camera eyes, laser gate controls, and the Imperial guards. The officer is the last of the guards to fall under the laserfire just as he is about to push the alarm system. Han rushes to the comlink system, which is screeching questions about what is going on.  He quickly checks the computer readout.

q: HAN: Go get him! The startled guards are momentarily dumbfounded. Luke and Han have already pulled out their laser pistols and are blasting away at the terrifying Wookiee. Their barrage of laserfire misses Chewbacca, but hits the camera eyes, laser gate controls, and the Imperial guards. The officer is the last of the guards to fall under the laserfire just as he is about to push the alarm system. Han rushes to the comlink system, which is screeching questions about what is going on.  He quickly checks the computer readout.
a: We've got to find out which cell this princess of yours is in. Here it is... cell twenty-one-eight-seven. You go get her. I'll hold them here. Luke races down one of the cell corridors. Han speaks into the buzzing comlink.

q: HAN: We've got to find out which cell this princess of yours is in. Here it is... cell twenty-one-eight-seven. You go get her. I'll hold them here. Luke races down one of the cell corridors. Han speaks into the buzzing comlink. sounding official
a: Everything is under control. Situation normal.

q: HAN: Everything is under control. Situation normal.
a: What happened?

q: INTERCOM VOICE: What happened? getting nervous
a: Uh... had a slight weapons malfunction. But, uh, everything's perfectly all right now. We're fine. We're all fine here, now, thank you. How are you?

q: HAN: Uh... had a slight weapons malfunction. But, uh, everything's perfectly all right now. We're fine. We're all fine here, now, thank you. How are you?
a: We're sending a squad up.

q: INTERCOM VOICE: We're sending a squad up.
a: Uh, uh, negative. We had a reactor leak here now. Give us a few minutes to lock it down. Large leak... very dangerous.

q: HAN: Uh, uh, negative. We had a reactor leak here now. Give us a few minutes to lock it down. Large leak... very dangerous.
a: Who is this? What's your operating number? Han blasts the comlink and it explodes.

q: INTERCOM VOICE: Who is this? What's your operating number? Han blasts the comlink and it explodes.
a: Boring conversation anyway. (yelling down the hall) Luke! We're going to have company! INT. DEATH STAR - CELL ROW Luke stops in front of one of the cells and blasts the door away with a laser pistol. When the smoke clears, Luke sees the dazzling young princess-senator. She had been sleeping and is now looking at him with an uncomprehending look on her face. Luke is stunned by her incredible beauty and stands staring at her with his mouth hanging open.

q: HAN: Boring conversation anyway. (yelling down the hall) Luke! We're going to have company! INT. DEATH STAR - CELL ROW Luke stops in front of one of the cells and blasts the door away with a laser pistol. When the smoke clears, Luke sees the dazzling young princess-senator. She had been sleeping and is now looking at him with an uncomprehending look on her face. Luke is stunned by her incredible beauty and stands staring at her with his mouth hanging open. finally
a: Aren't you a little short to be a stormtrooper? Luke takes off his helmet, coming out of it.

q: LEIA: Aren't you a little short to be a stormtrooper? Luke takes off his helmet, coming out of it.
a: What? Oh... the uniform. I'm Luke Skywalker. I'm here to rescue you.

q: LUKE: What? Oh... the uniform. I'm Luke Skywalker. I'm here to rescue you.
a: You're who?

q: LEIA: You're who?
a: I'm here to rescue you. I've got your R2 unit. I'm here with Ben Kenobi.

q: LUKE: I'm here to rescue you. I've got your R2 unit. I'm here with Ben Kenobi.
a: Ben Kenobi is here! Where is he?

q: LEIA: Ben Kenobi is here! Where is he?
a: Come on! INT. DEATH STAR - CONFERENCE ROOM Darth Vader paces the room as Governor Tarkin sits at the far end of the conference table.

q: LUKE: Come on! INT. DEATH STAR - CONFERENCE ROOM Darth Vader paces the room as Governor Tarkin sits at the far end of the conference table.
a: He is here...

q: VADER: He is here...
a: Obi-Wan Kenobi! What makes you think so?

q: TARKIN: Obi-Wan Kenobi! What makes you think so?
a: A tremor in the Force. The last time I felt it was in the presence of my old master.

q: VADER: A tremor in the Force. The last time I felt it was in the presence of my old master.
a: Surely he must be dead by now.

q: TARKIN: Surely he must be dead by now.
a: Don't underestimate the power of the Force.

q: VADER: Don't underestimate the power of the Force.
a: The Jedi are extinct, their fire has gone out of the universe. You, my friend, are all that's left of their religion. There is a quiet buzz on the comlink.

q: TARKIN: The Jedi are extinct, their fire has gone out of the universe. You, my friend, are all that's left of their religion. There is a quiet buzz on the comlink.
a: Yes.

q: TARKIN: Yes.
a: Governor Tarkin, we have an emergency alert in detention block A A-twenty- three.

q: INTERCOM VOICE: Governor Tarkin, we have an emergency alert in detention block A A-twenty- three.
a: The princess! Put all sections on alert!

q: TARKIN: The princess! Put all sections on alert!
a: Obi-Wan is here. The Force is with him.

q: VADER: Obi-Wan is here. The Force is with him.
a: If you're right, he must not be allowed to escape.

q: TARKIN: If you're right, he must not be allowed to escape.
a: Escape is not his plan. I must face him alone. INT. DEATH STAR - DETENTION AREA - HALLWAY An ominous buzzing sound is heard on the other side of the elevator door.

q: VADER: Escape is not his plan. I must face him alone. INT. DEATH STAR - DETENTION AREA - HALLWAY An ominous buzzing sound is heard on the other side of the elevator door.
a: Chewie! Chewbacca responds with a growling noise.

q: HAN: Chewie! Chewbacca responds with a growling noise.
a: Get behind me! Get behind me! A series of explosions knock a hole in the elevator door through which several Imperial troops begin to emerge. Han and Chewie fire laser pistols at them through the smoke and flame. They turn and run down the cell hallway, meeting up with Luke and Leia rushing toward them.

q: HAN: Get behind me! Get behind me! A series of explosions knock a hole in the elevator door through which several Imperial troops begin to emerge. Han and Chewie fire laser pistols at them through the smoke and flame. They turn and run down the cell hallway, meeting up with Luke and Leia rushing toward them.
a: Can't get out that way.

q: HAN: Can't get out that way.
a: Looks like you managed to cut off our only escape route.

q: LEIA: Looks like you managed to cut off our only escape route. sarcastically
a: Maybe you'd like it back in your cell, Your Highness. Luke takes a small comlink transmitter from his belt as they continue to exchange fire with stormtroopers making their way down the corridor.

q: HAN: Maybe you'd like it back in your cell, Your Highness. Luke takes a small comlink transmitter from his belt as they continue to exchange fire with stormtroopers making their way down the corridor.
a: See-Threepio! See-Threepio!

q: LUKE: See-Threepio! See-Threepio! over comlink
a: Yes sir?

q: THREEPIO: Yes sir?
a: We've been cut off! Are there any other ways out of the cell bay?... What was that? I didn't copy! INT. DEATH STAR - MAIN BAY GANTRY - CONTROL TOWER Threepio paces the control center as little Artoo beeps and whistles a blue streak. Threepio yells into the small comlink transmitter.

q: LUKE: We've been cut off! Are there any other ways out of the cell bay?... What was that? I didn't copy! INT. DEATH STAR - MAIN BAY GANTRY - CONTROL TOWER Threepio paces the control center as little Artoo beeps and whistles a blue streak. Threepio yells into the small comlink transmitter.
a: I said, all systems have been alerted to your presence, sir. The main entrance seems to be the only way in or out; all other information on your level is restricted. Someone begins banging on the door.

q: THREEPIO: I said, all systems have been alerted to your presence, sir. The main entrance seems to be the only way in or out; all other information on your level is restricted. Someone begins banging on the door.
a: Open up in there!

a: Oh, no! INT. DEATH STAR - DETENTION CORRIDOR Luke and Leia crouch together in an alcove for protection as they continue to exchange fire with troops. Han and Chewbacca are barely able to keep the stormtroopers at bay at the far and of the hallway. The laserfire is very intense, and smoke fills the narrow cell corridor.

q: THREEPIO: Oh, no! INT. DEATH STAR - DETENTION CORRIDOR Luke and Leia crouch together in an alcove for protection as they continue to exchange fire with troops. Han and Chewbacca are barely able to keep the stormtroopers at bay at the far and of the hallway. The laserfire is very intense, and smoke fills the narrow cell corridor.
a: There isn't any other way out.

q: LUKE: There isn't any other way out.
a: I can't hold them off forever! Now what?

q: HAN: I can't hold them off forever! Now what?
a: This is some rescue. When you came in here, didn't you have a plan for getting out?

q: LEIA: This is some rescue. When you came in here, didn't you have a plan for getting out? pointing to Luke
a: He's the brains, sweetheart. Luke manages a sheepish grin and shrugs his shoulders.

q: HAN: He's the brains, sweetheart. Luke manages a sheepish grin and shrugs his shoulders.
a: Well, I didn't... The princess grabs Luke's gun and fires at a small grate in the wall next to Han, almost frying him.

q: LUKE: Well, I didn't... The princess grabs Luke's gun and fires at a small grate in the wall next to Han, almost frying him.
a: What the hell are you doing?

q: HAN: What the hell are you doing?
a: Somebody has to save our skins. Into the garbage chute, wise guy. She jumps through the narrow opening as Han and Chewbacca look on in amazement. Chewbacca sniffs the garbage chute and says something.

q: LEIA: Somebody has to save our skins. Into the garbage chute, wise guy. She jumps through the narrow opening as Han and Chewbacca look on in amazement. Chewbacca sniffs the garbage chute and says something.
a: Get in there you big furry oaf! I don't care what you smell! Get in there and don't worry about it. Han gives him a kick and the Wookiee disappears into the tiny opening. Luke and Han continue firing as they work their way toward the opening.

q: HAN: Get in there you big furry oaf! I don't care what you smell! Get in there and don't worry about it. Han gives him a kick and the Wookiee disappears into the tiny opening. Luke and Han continue firing as they work their way toward the opening.
a: Wonderful girl! Either I'm going to kill her or I'm beginning to like her. Get in there! Luke ducks laserfire as he jumps into the darkness. Han fires off a couple of quick blasts creating a smokey cover, then slides into the chute himself and is gone. INT. DEATH STAR - GARBAGE ROOM Han tumbles into the large room filled with garbage and muck. Luke is already stumbling around looking for an exit. He finds a small hatchway and struggles to get it open. It won't budge.

q: HAN: Wonderful girl! Either I'm going to kill her or I'm beginning to like her. Get in there! Luke ducks laserfire as he jumps into the darkness. Han fires off a couple of quick blasts creating a smokey cover, then slides into the chute himself and is gone. INT. DEATH STAR - GARBAGE ROOM Han tumbles into the large room filled with garbage and muck. Luke is already stumbling around looking for an exit. He finds a small hatchway and struggles to get it open. It won't budge. sarcastically
a: Oh! The garbage chute was a really wonderful idea. What an incredible smell you've discovered! Let's get out of here! Get away from there...

q: HAN: Oh! The garbage chute was a really wonderful idea. What an incredible smell you've discovered! Let's get out of here! Get away from there...
a: No! wait! Han draws his laser pistol and fires at the hatch. The laserbolt ricochets wildly around the small metal room. Everyone dives for cover in the garbage as the bolt explodes almost on top of them. Leia climbs out of the garbage with a rather grim look on her face.

q: LUKE: No! wait! Han draws his laser pistol and fires at the hatch. The laserbolt ricochets wildly around the small metal room. Everyone dives for cover in the garbage as the bolt explodes almost on top of them. Leia climbs out of the garbage with a rather grim look on her face.
a: Will you forget it? I already tried it. It's magnetically sealed!

q: LUKE: Will you forget it? I already tried it. It's magnetically sealed!
a: Put that thing away! You're going to get us all killed.

q: LEIA: Put that thing away! You're going to get us all killed.
a: Absolutely, Your Worship. Look, I had everything under control until you led us down here. You know, it's not going to take them long to figure out what happened to us.

q: HAN: Absolutely, Your Worship. Look, I had everything under control until you led us down here. You know, it's not going to take them long to figure out what happened to us.
a: It could be worse... A loud, horrible, inhuman moan works its way up from the murky depths. Chewbacca lets out a terrified howl and begins to back away. Han and Luke stand fast with their laser pistols drawn. The Wookiee is cowering near one of the walls.

q: LEIA: It could be worse... A loud, horrible, inhuman moan works its way up from the murky depths. Chewbacca lets out a terrified howl and begins to back away. Han and Luke stand fast with their laser pistols drawn. The Wookiee is cowering near one of the walls.
a: It's worse.

q: HAN: It's worse.
a: There's something alive in here!

q: LUKE: There's something alive in here!
a: That's your imagination.

q: HAN: That's your imagination.
a: Something just moves past my leg! Look! Did you see that?

q: LUKE: Something just moves past my leg! Look! Did you see that?
a: What?

q: HAN: What?
a: Help! Suddenly Luke is yanked under the garbage.

q: LUKE: Help! Suddenly Luke is yanked under the garbage.
a: Luke! Luke! Luke! Solo tries to get to Luke. Luke surfaces with a gasp of air and thrashing of limbs. A membrane tentacle is wrapped around his throat.

q: HAN: Luke! Luke! Luke! Solo tries to get to Luke. Luke surfaces with a gasp of air and thrashing of limbs. A membrane tentacle is wrapped around his throat.
a: Luke! Leia extends a long pipe toward him.

q: LEIA: Luke! Leia extends a long pipe toward him.
a: Luke, Luke, grab a hold of this.

q: LEIA: Luke, Luke, grab a hold of this.
a: Blast it, will you! My gun's jammed.

q: LUKE: Blast it, will you! My gun's jammed.
a: Where?

q: HAN: Where?
a: Anywhere! Oh!! Solo fires his gun downward. Luke is pulled back into the muck by the slimy tentacle.

q: LUKE: Anywhere! Oh!! Solo fires his gun downward. Luke is pulled back into the muck by the slimy tentacle.
a: Luke! Luke! Suddenly the walls of the garbage receptacle shudder and move in a couple of inches. Then everything is deathly quiet. Han and Leia give each other a worried look as Chewbacca howls in the corner. With a rush of bubbles and muck Luke suddenly bobs to the surface.

q: HAN: Luke! Luke! Suddenly the walls of the garbage receptacle shudder and move in a couple of inches. Then everything is deathly quiet. Han and Leia give each other a worried look as Chewbacca howls in the corner. With a rush of bubbles and muck Luke suddenly bobs to the surface.

q: LEIA: Grab him! Luke seems to be released by the thing.
a: What happened?

q: LEIA: What happened?

a: Written by Lawrence Kasdan and Leigh Brackett From a story by George Lucas EXT. GALAXY - PLANET HOTH A Star Destroyer moves through space, releasing Imperial probe robots from its underside. One of these probes zooms toward the planet Hoth and lands on its ice- covered surface.  An explosion marks the point of impact. EXT. HOTH - METEORITE CRATER - SNOW PLAIN - DAY A weird mechanical sound rises above the whining of the wind.  A strange probe robot, with several extended sensors, emerges from the smoke-shrouded crater.  The ominous mechanical probe floats across the snow plain and disappears into the distance. EXT. PLAIN OF HOTH - DAY A small figure gallops across the windswept ice slope.  The bundled rider is mounted on a large gray snow lizard, a Tauntaun.  Curving plumes of snow rise from beneath the speeding paws of the two-legged beast. The rider gallops up a slope and reins his lizard to a stop.  Pulling off his protective goggles, Luke Skywalker notices something in the sky.  He takes a pair of electrobinoculars from his utility belt and through them sees smoke rising from where the probe robot has crashed. The wind whips at Luke's fur-lined cap and he activates a comlink transmitter.  His Tauntaun shifts and moans nervously beneath him.

HOTH - ICE GORGE - DUSK The jagged face of a huge ice wall sits gloomily in the dim twilight of a Hoth day.  Luke hangs upside down, ankles frozen into icy stalactites, his extended arms within a foot of the snow floor.  One side of his face is covered in a dried mask of frozen blood.  He opens his eyes as a chilling moan of the hideous ice creature echoes off the gorge walls.  Luke pulls himself up, grabs hold of his ankles, and futilely tries to unfasten the throngs. Exhausted, he drops back into his hanging position.  As he hangs there, he spies his lightsaber lying near a pile of his discarded gear, about three feet out of reach. He focuses on the saber and, as his hand strains toward the weapon, he squeezes his eyes tight in concentration. Just as the ice creature looms over Luke, the lightsaber jumps into Luke's hand. The young warrior instantly ignites his sword, swinging up, and cuts himself loose from the ice.  He flops to the snow in a heap.  The startled creature moves back, his giant yellow eyes blinking.  Luke scrambles to his feet.  He swings his lightsaber and the beast screams in pain. EXT. HOTH - ENTRANCE TO ICE GORGE - DUSK Luke staggers out of the gorge into the dark and snowy twilight.  Weak and exhausted, he stumbles down a snow bank. EXT. HOTH - SNOW PLAIN - DUSK A small, lone figure riding a Tauntaun races through the hostile vastness of snow and cold.  As it runs, the Tauntaun's legs kick up large clouds of snow and ice into the snowy air. EXT. HOTH - OUTSIDE ICE				 HANGAR - DUSK Artoo stands in the falling snow, beeping worriedly.  Threepio moves stiffly over to him.

Instantly, the probe robot swings around, its deadly ray ready to fire.  But before it can get a shot off, it is hit from behind by a laser bolt, and explodes in a million pieces. Han Solo replaces his blaster in its holster and peers intently at the smoldering remains of the Imperial probe. INT. HOTH - BATTLEFIELD - ICE PLAIN On the battlefield, Luke watches as a walker foot rises and moves over him.  He looks up at the underbelly of the huge walker, passing overhead. Running beneath the monstrous machine, Luke fires his harpoon gun at the walker's underside.  A thin cable follows the projectile from the gun.  The magnetic head and cable attach firmly to the metal hull. Still running under the walker, Luke attaches the cable drum to his belt buckle.  Soon he is pulled up the cable and hangs dangling underneath the walker. The walker's giant feet continue to pound onward across the frozen snow.  Stray laser bolts whistle by Luke as he climbs up the cable to the walker's hull, reaching a small hatch.  Hanging precariously, Luke cuts the solid metal hatch with his laser sword. He takes a landmine from around his neck and throws it inside the Imperial machine.  Quickly, Luke starts down the cable and crashes onto the icy ground far below.  He lies unconscious as a giant rear leg passes by - and just misses him. The giant walker stops in mid-step.  A muffled explosion comes from within - and then the walker's mechanical insides  are spewed out every conceivable opening.  The machine sits dead in its tracks, smoking like a locomotive on stilts. CREATURE'S HOUSE Artoo, peeking in the window, sees the inside of the house - a very plain, but cozy dwelling.  Everything is in the same small scale as the creature.  The only thing out of place in the miniature room is Luke, whose height makes the four-foot ceiling seem even lower.  He sits cross-legged on the floor of the living room. The creature is in an adjoining area - his little kitchen - cooking up an incredible meal.  The stove is a steaming hodgepodge of pots and pans.  The wizened little host scurries about chopping this, shredding that, and showering everything with exotic herbs and spices.  He rushes back and forth putting platters on the table in front of Luke, who watches the creature impatiently.

Leia and Chewbacca start firing at the troopers as Lando makes a break for the elevator.  Laser bolts continue to explode around the princess and the Wookiee, but they refuse to budge.  Lando sticks his head out of the elevator and motions for the pair to run, but they barely notice.  They seem possessed, transported, as all the frustration of captivity and anger of loss pour through their death-dealing weapons. But after a few moments, they begin to move through the rain of laser fire toward the elevator.  Once they are inside, the door slams shut and the stormtroopers race forward. INT. CLOUD CITY - CARBON-FREEZING CHAMBER Luke and Vader are locked in combat on the platform overlooking the chamber.  Their swords clash, the platform sways.  Luke aggressively drives Vader back, forcing Vader to use defensive tactics.

a: You'll find I'm full of surprises. Vader makes two quick moves, hooking Luke's sword out of his hand and sending it flying.  Another lightning move at Luke's feet forces the youth to jump back to protect himself.  Losing his balance, Luke rolls down the stairs to the circular carbon-freezing platform.  There he sprawls on the floor, surprised and shaken.  Just in time he looks up to see Vader, like a giant black bird, flying right at him.  Luke rolls away as Vader lands.  Crouching, Luke keeps his gaze steadily on his enemy.

a: No! Behind Luke the hydraulic elevator cover has opened noiselessly.  All the while, Luke slowly, cautiously moves back, away from the Dark Lord. Vader turns aside and deactivates his sword.

a: All to easy.  Perhaps you are not as strong as the Emperor thought. Through the steam behind Vader something blurs upward.  Liquid metal begins to pour into the pit. Vader turns around - and then looks up.  He sees Luke, who has leaped fifteen feet straight up and who now hangs from some hoses on the carbonite outlet.

a: Impressive... most impressive. Luke jumps down to the platform where he is separated from Vader by the steaming carbonite pit.  He raises his hand.  His sword, which had fallen on another part of the platform, swiftly jumps into his outstretched hand and is instantly ignited.  Vader immediately lights his sword as well.

a: Obi-Wan has taught you well.  You have controlled your fear... now release your anger. Luke is more cautious, controlling his anger.  He begins to retreat as Vader goads him on.  As Luke takes a defensive position, he realizes he has been foolhardy.  A quick sword exchange and Luke forces Vader back. Another exchange and Vader retreats.  Luke presses forward.

q: VADER: Obi-Wan has taught you well.  You have controlled your fear... now release your anger. Luke is more cautious, controlling his anger.  He begins to retreat as Vader goads him on.
